T1.label: Domestic Growth Re-Accelerates
T1.description: Guzman y Gomez executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
T1.plain_english: Same-store sales growth returns to 7%+ as new store formats, menu innovation, and drive-through rollout drive higher throughput. Domestic network grows from 194 toward 500+ stores.
T1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
T1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
T1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

T2.label: US Expansion Succeeds
T2.description: Guzman y Gomez delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
T2.plain_english: Chicago stores achieve profitability; model proven and scaled across US markets. GYG replicates the Chipotle playbook from an Australian base.
T2.upside: See research report for upside scenario detail.
T2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

T3.label: Growth Maturation / Valuation Correction
T3.description: Guzman y Gomez faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
T3.plain_english: GYG is a good domestic QSR brand that was overvalued at IPO. The multiple contracts to reflect its actual growth trajectory. 166x P/E is unjustifiable for a restaurant business.
T3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
T3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

T4.label: US Losses Force Strategic Retreat
T4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for Guzman y Gomez
T4.plain_english: Mounting US losses and board pressure force GYG to scale back or exit the US, refocusing on profitable domestic operations. Founder departure creates the catalyst for strategic reset.
T4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
T4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: Highest-profile post-IPO disappointment on the ASX. Listed June 2024 at A$22, peaked at A$46, now A$19.50 (below IPO price). Domestic same-store sales decelerated to 3.7% (vs 7.6% prospectus forecast). US expansion: 5 Chicago stores generating A$13.2M in losses with deeper FY26 losses projected. Founder-CEO stepping down. At 166x P/E the stock still prices in growth that is not materialising.
